topic.title: HPE Helion Development Platform 2.0: Downloading Before Installation

body.p: If downloading during installation is not your preferred option, or if security measures prevent direct download, you can download the files prior to beginning installation. If you do not download the files prior to installation, they will be downloaded as part of the installation process.

The easiest option is to download directly to the physical machine hosting the HPE Helion OpenStack lifecycle manager. If you can not download directly to that location, download the files to portable storage media and then copy the files onto the lifecycle manager. When downloading or copying, make sure there is enough space; the file sizes can be significant.

ol.li: Using your preferred Web browser, navigate to the HPE Helion Download Network (HDN).
If necessary, create an account, and then log in.
Click the Download button in the left navigation panel.

Click to select the service you wish to download. A complete installation consists of:
HPE Helion Development Platform Installer (HDPI)
Application Lifecycle Service (ALS)
Database Service
Messaging Broker Service
HPE Helion Code Engine
Click the blue Download button at the top right of the screen to begin the download.
After you have finished downloading, follow the installation instructions provided for each service.

body.note: When installing services using pre-downloaded files, the HDPI must be launched from the same directory that contains the installation files. If the installer cannot find a required file in the same directory, it will attempt to download the files again.
